It disgusted me in every way shape and form, thank god that it was my last night there because I probably would have gone to another hotel because I felt like there were bugs crawling on me the whole time. I just dont understand why such a nice hotel would offer such bad service usually you get it from the employees not management? You can totally tell that the manager has not been in the business long enough to run a hotel. I hope she is not the only person making executive decisions. With all this being said as I have read other reviews im not the only one who has experienced horrible things at this hotel. If things ever change around there please advertise it so I can give you guys another shot I truly think that this place can be a wonderful place to stay and enjoy a vacation... Its not the hotel that needs a face lift its peoples attitudes and thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out! Just a little FYI on my experiences...”
Reviews.Author: RUGBY123
Reviews.Content: The rooms are absolutely gorgeous and are right in the smack middle of downtown, however, they fail to mention that on top of the cost of the hotel you have to put down a $150 holding fee in case there are any damages. This is a huge inconvenience for more of the younger crowd who simply go with just enough money and now do not have enough for this extra fee they fail to mention on their website and additionally while making reservations. Oh, AND I guess they want more money if you wanted to do a cash holding fee instead..something more like $260. That is ridiculous, especially since they don't give you any heads up what so ever! Also, DO NOT valet your car with them! I understand the company that valet's for The Keating is a completely separate company, however, I got my brand new 2010 car back with a flat tire and fluids leaking from the engine! Not only did they let me drive off knowing this, but it has been such a hassle to have to pay out of pocket for my tire and repair costs. Other than that, The Keating is a perfect place to party!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place ... if you don't need to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: onspecial Posted by a Luxury Link traveler
Reviews.Content: The Keating has a great location, nice staff and our hotel suite had plenty of room to move around. We had a great stroll in the Gas Lamp District, wonderful dinner at Kroces and settle in to watch a PPV movie and enjoy a glass of wine. At 10 PM a band at a nightclub, below our room begin to play ... and it did not stop. At 1 AM the staff move us up two floors and although the vibration of the drums and guitars became less, you could still hear the music and the people. At 6 AM the next morning the trash truck awoke us with the beautful sound of bottles breaking. We strategically planned our next night, went for dinner a little later, took two Excedrin PMs AND used complimentary ear plugs (hmmm wonder why they supply these). If you are planning a relaxing getaway with plenty of sleep ... this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Our kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 619Family
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take the kids for a fun getaway downtown. We decided on the Keating because of the location and cool design. Our son loves racecars so this place was a dream. Each floor has a replica Ferrari in the hallway. The bathtub is even the same design as a Ferrari's rearview mirror. We spent the day downtown and at Seaport Village. In the evening we took the kids to their first night movie at the Gaslamp Theaters and had dinner at The Merk downstairs. I had the most amazing swordfish and my kids LOVED the pizza. We plan on staying at the Keating again this summer. It's such a great location! We also loved the wonderful bed and amazing shower!

Reviews.Title: “pretty awful”
Reviews.Author: jorgio
Reviews.Content: This place is all appearance and no substance. Good to take picture for a designer magazine but nothing else. And a bad concept of design, in fact, which no thought given to the purpose and the positioning of the furniture. The end result is an uncorfortable room. The staff seems to have little idea of what their job is about. The Gaslamp district is central but very noisy all night. Room prices are just madness. Quite simply not suited for tourists or business travellers

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Bonjour4
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Keating last weekend was Great! The service was amazing and fast. Anything we asked for came up to our room within minutes. Very exceptional design and clean. LOVED the turn down service with italian cookies. Location was fabulous, close to shopping, dining and partying. Their lounge was great for an after dinner drink with friends. The best part was the BEDS! You never want to get out of Bed!

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: Vacubcaquix
Reviews.Content: Awful, rude service - small uncomfortable rooms - this nonsense about "modern open design" just means your bed is in your bathroom! The location seems great - but the Gaslamp district is unbelievably noisy all night - with loud garbage trucks in the wee hours - every morning. Also more expensive than a luxury hotel in New York! Unreal prices! If you're into torture and punishment - if you're into being fleeced - then this is the place for you - otherwise, steer clear. The worst clip joint I have ever seen, and I have traveled all over the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DGTravelerSD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a reomantic getaway and chose The Keating. Boy, were we happy with our decision! Our stay was exceptional. The location couldn't be any better - a block in any direction to Horton Plaza, great bars and restaurants, etc. We were right in the middle of the Gaslamp. The staff was very professional and friendly. The rooms were uber-modern with a bed to die for - we slept for 10 hrs straight! Don't let the outside fool you - this is truly a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: hdp123
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Keating was awful. They moved us from the first room because we found cockroaches in the alarm clock, of all places. The second room was bug free, but there were still problems. Our room key didn't work 80% of the time and there is only one elevator, so going up and down four flights of stairs every time we needed to get into the room was a hassle. Also, the shower water was luke warm and it is very noisy. We kind of expected a one night room comp because of the roaches, and were instead given dinner at their mediocre restaraunt. We will not be returning to the Keating.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function at The Keating”
Reviews.Author: mmminla
Reviews.Content: The Keating is one of those hotels that tries so hard to be hip it forgets that its guests just want a nice room with no hassle. The one good thing I can say about the room - Penthouse C - is that the bed was ultra-comfortable and the room was clean. Most everything else was a problem - from the cold cement floors, to the over-designed sinks and showers that require a call to the front desk to figure them out, to the lighting system that you can't operate from the bed, to the noisy elevator that can be heard from the room, to the bad breakfast recommendation (don't go to Brian's), there was little to like in our experience. If you're looking for a hotel where you don't need an instruction manual to operate the lights, TV or shower, don't choose The Keating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Visit at The Keating”
Reviews.Author: OCCouple2004
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great hotel. The location is perfect, located right in Gaslamp, walking distance to everything; Horton Plaza, Seaport Village, Bars, Restaurants, Little Italy, etc. The hotel is very chic and clean, the bed was very comfortable, the shower was heavenly. The staff was very helpful. Like some of the previous reviews, you do hear the street/ bar noise... thats pretty unavoidable in Gaslamp. If you like a small botique hotel in the city, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Speir
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, I was somewhat reticent to stay at the Keating, but I am quite glad to report that the criticisms levied against the Keating here are a bit overwrought. The primary negative of this hotel, or any hotel in the Gaslamp District, is that you are at Ground Zero of the San Diego social scene. With that comes noise and crowds of people, but the U.S. Grant, Ivy, and Sofia all have similar problems (or worse). As for the hotel itself, the hotel is uber cool (designed by Ferrari designer Pininfarina), with custom designed furniture and room elements in each room and Bang & Olufsen electronics. Rooms are comfortable but spartan, as would befit a Pininfarina remake of a hotel built in 1890. The bed was one of the best I have ever experienced in a hotel. The room floor was painted concrete, and the shower was exposed (with no curtain - by design), but the girlfriend and I found the room to be both comfortable and charming. As would befit a 4 star hotel, the hotel staff was tremendous - eager to help and extremely responsive. We got extremely accurate recommendations on local restaurants and watering holes. The downstairs bar (Minus One) is a nice perk of the Hotel, as admission is guaranteed to guests and the bar turns out to be one of the "go to" spots late night (after 1 a.m.), after other Gaslamp establishments go to last call. All in all, a great stay, and we would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: AZTRAVEL8R
Reviews.Content: So a friend recommended staying at this new place in downtown San Diego. I haven't been back to San Diego in years, and wow what an experience! Downtown has grown! It is a happening place. Restaurant after restaurant; nightclub after nightclub...This place is booming. We stayed at the Keating, and I was impressed. The hotel was amazing. The service was above and beyond. They do a special turn down service, and left a nice little surprise each night when we returned to our room. It almost reminded me of when I took a cruise, and they wait on you hand and foot. I definitely recommend this place. The Beds! My wife and I both agree, we have not slept like that in years. I have to rave about the beds. Hands down the most comfy bed I have slept in. Really romantic place, great place to get away for the weekend. San Diego has so much to offer, and the staff at the keating were so helpful and nice. Definitely the place to come when visiting San Diego. We did not check out there lounge underneath the hotel, but it seemed really busy. Will have to come back for the whole experience next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever received.”
Reviews.Author: missanthropy15
Reviews.Content: Although it is true that The Keating is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in, the form and flair was grossly overshadowed by the shoddy service that I received. My husband and I are not in denial that we are 'hotel snobs', so The Keating seemed like a natural choice for our weekend trip to San Diego. I was both anxious and excited to experience the sophisticated service and amenities boasted on the hotel website and literature. Unfortunately, when we arrived at the hotel we were advised that our room would not be ready for 3 hours, so we checked our bags and went off to explore the city. When we returned 3 hours later, we sat waiting for 15 minutes while another guest checked in and were completely ignored by the other desk staff. When we were finally approached to check into the hotel, we were advised of the 'unfortunate news' that they were unable to fulfill our confirmed reservation, but would guarantee an upgraded room the following night. When I opened the envelope containing our alternate arangements, they were sending us to the Comfort Inn down the street!!! I could not have been more insulted. My husband and I were furious, but were repeatedly told that there was nothing more that could be done. When I asked the reason for being relocated, we were told that the prior evenings guests simply refused to leave! I also asked why we were not told of this 3 hours prior when we first arrived and why the guests who were at the desk when we returned were able to check in and no answers were given to my inquiries. I advised the desk staff that the accomodations they were attempting to provide us were not acceptable and I was again told that there were no other options and that there were simply no reservations in the downtown area available. When I demanded my reservation canceled and my money returned, suddenly there was another option (proving the staff to have lied) available and we were sent to the Westgate which was a few blocks away. The Keating staff expected us to walk to the new hotel with all of our luggage in tow to the new hotel. The Westgate was absolutely lovely. The service was top notch and the room was stunningly beautiful! When we returned to The Keating the next day, our room was not ready. We checked our bags and went out for the day. When we returned we were escorted to our room and received personalized check in service. The room was beautiful. We were upgraded to a room with a jacuzzi tub, which was a nice touch. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We did not receive the personalized mini bar or turndown service, which are boasted in The Keating literature. The espresso bar is nice, but there is no cream provided. The shower is lovely, but it does leak out onto the floor as there are no doors. That really wasn't a big deal. The floors are finished concrete so there was no danger of slipping. Later in the evening, I called the front desk to inquire about having some ice delivered to the room. An hour later, I was still waiting for the ice. I walked down to the front desk and my ice was sitting there melted next to the desk clerk. I took it up to my room myself. No apology was offered for the delay or the inconvenience. That same evening, I called the front desk to ask for napkins and was told that they would be delivered to my room. I didn't hold my breath and it is a good thing as they were not delivered until 45 minutes later. The noise level is very high, as the other reviews state. Having already read some of the reviews of this hotel, I was somewhat prepared for it. There are earplugs provided in the room. Overall, the hotel itself was georgeous, but I was sincerely unable to enjoy myself as a result of the horrible service I received. I feel that my weekend away was ruined by the Keating staff. The hotel staff are very young and inexperienced. They are just simply incapable of offering the kind of service that the hotel advertises. I was severely disappointed and can not recommend this hotel. I can, however, highly recommend the Wesgate. I have written a letter to The Keating to discuss my experience and have received no reply.

Reviews.Title: “Get Ready for Sleepless Nights -- I might as well sleep in the airport!”
Reviews.Author: bdcToronto
Reviews.Content: I went to the Keating in early August. First impression, was WOW what a cool hotel. Gadgets galore very swanky! The room smelt musty as the shower was open concept. (it was right in front of the bed). A great place for voyeurs but not two buddys traveling together. The hotel is in a great location right in the heart of the GASLAMP distrcict. The breakfast was awful! Stale muffins, outdated yogurt and ripened bananas. My biggest quam was the singled paneled windows. I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and had 3 TERRIBLE sleeps. You are right beside a bar and the music is blarring. You can hear everything. They gave earplugs with the room --- now I see why. With this hotel you sacrifice a good night's sleep with swanky rooms and locaton. Staff was great and friendly. Overall, a negative experience.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEPLESS in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: HAMToronto
Reviews.Content: The Keating Hotel is loud! While the minimalist design is breathtaking, and its hi tech in-room gadgets are wonderful, nothing is worth the noise that you will encounter when you chose to stay at this hotel. The hotel upgraded us to the Imperial room, which was large and beautiful, with its high ceilings, large windows and plasma TV's. The room design definitely had its flaws which included an amazing shower that leaked all over the floor, and a misplaced plasma that blocked the washroom, but was beautiful nonetheless. While the Keating appears to be a modernists dream, it is not until you try to fall asleep that you realize you will be dreaming of nothing as sleep is hard to come by.We are a young couple, we go out and we understand what the area is about . I understand hearing outside noises, especially when you chose to stay in the Gaslamp district...this is expected. What is not is the vibrations and loud beats that could be heard through the floor and windows that not only kept us awake but literally shook our bed. After calling down to ask what time the bar closes, after calling a second time to see if anything could be done, after putting in the provided earplugs (isn't that a really bad sign), still no relief!!! It felt as though we were lying inside the bar (the bed is super comfy, but who cares if you can't sleep). This hotel has a major noise problem and they don't really seem to care! After complaining upon checkout we were pretty much told that it was our decision to stay at the hotel. We were also told that it was the Gaslamp district (no apologies). After asking to speak with the manager we were told that we were checking out too early and she would not be in until later. After calling the manager we were told that there was nothing she could do before talking to accounting, AND after waiting for her to call us back....well, we are still waiting. BOTTOM LINE, this hotel is NOISY and not worth your money. Some of the staff are very nice but are very inexperienced in hospitality. Valet service is fine, a bit slow, and other than valet I'm not really sure of any other services because we were not told about them.SAVE YOUR MONEY AND YOUR AGGRAVATION, THIS HOTEL IS NOT WORTH IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: MrsKD
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Keating on a Saturday night. First impressions were wow, what a fab room, we were upgraded to a Suite which was modern Italian in design, open plan. Very comfortable bed indeed, nice high ceilings and lots of gadgets. I felt after being there a while that so much emphasis was put on the high tech this n that, that basic comforts were lacking. For example I went to put on their nice robe from the closet and it was still wet inside the arms, The radio didn't work, scale in the bathroom didn't work. We were right above the hotel bar downstairs, very loud until about 3 am. Luckily we had been out til very late anyway and you need to be if you stay at this hotel. so as not to make you grumpy with all the noise. Nice expresso machine, but no tea on offer or cream for the coffee for those who may like cream so I had to go searching for some in the morning. Found the breakfast room, lovely big room with huge windows and there in the corner a small little table with stale poppyseed muffins, a few stale pastries, some very over ripe bananas. Coffee & Juice. They could do so much with that room by offering fresh croissant, cereals, tea, fresh fruit , newspapers etc. and for a "Luxury Boutique Hotel" breakfast was worse than I have ever had at a Budget Hotel. Such a shame and such a lovely room!!. There was a mix up on our bill and it took about 20 mins for the staff to figure out how to use the computer system to erase the charge and fix it. The staff were very friendly and polite but they need to take care of the basics and forget about how many features the expresso machine has. Hopefully these are teething probs that will remedy in time and make the hotel really worthy of calling itself a Luxury Boutique Hotel. "Mr Tiki" across the road had great food and atmosphere. We went to "The Field" Irish pub for a really nice Irish breakfast, yummy!!

Reviews.Title: “Noise Ruins What is Otherwise a Luxe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: When I plan a trip, I spend an inordinate amount of time researching hotels to ensure that our accommodations will be perfect. I wish I had done that before I booked the Keating. My chief complaint was, yes, the noise. The weekend of my stay coincided with Pride, so there may have been more revelers in the Gaslamp Quarter than usual. However, it appears that the main culprit was the hotelâ€™s own lounge bar, Minus 1, which, according to one of the front desk staff, is the only place that is open until 3-4am in the morning. Earplugs did nothing to minimize the thumping music, the roaring crowds, or the police sirens. I decided to pop a Benadryl around 3:15am and that worked like a charm. A girl needs her beauty sleep! The hotel is located in the heart of the Gaslamp District and a short walk to the Horton Plaza. When I arrived at the hotel, I had to wait a few minutes curbside, as the valet driver was nowhere to be found. Beware â€“ overnight parking is $30 per night! Check-in was a breeze. I do agree with earlier reviewers that staff need additional training in hospitality and professionalism. Everyone was friendly enough, but there was just something lacking. I was escorted to my room by a young woman, but when we got there, it was apparent that the room had not been cleaned since the prior occupantsâ€™ departure. After being advised that the room would be ready in 20-30 minutes, I left my bags and walked over to Horton Plaza to check out the Nordstrom Anniversary sale. The staff had assured me that they would call my cell phone as soon as the room was ready. I never received a call but when I returned an hour later, the room was indeed ready. The same young woman escorted me up to my room. After showing me how to use the television (Bang & Olufsen HDTV, no less) and the espresso machine, she made me a solo shot on the spot. I stayed in a standard room, the Stanza. The room was on the top floor and faced the street. Here come some big pluses. The king-sized bed was absolutely comfortable with tons of down pillows (too bad I didnâ€™t get much of an opportunity to enjoy sleeping in it). Towels were plush, as were the bath mats. Robes and slippers are provided. The aforementioned tv is a wall-mounted flatscreen and every couch potatoâ€™s fantasy. On one of the nightstands lies a Sanctuary, a little white box containing no less than 11 cell phone chargers, which I used to charge my iPhone. Of course, the mini-fridge came packed with petite libations â€“ Vitamin Water, Perrier, soda, and alcohol. The snacks looked very appetizing - tres chic square packages of roasted almonds, cheese crisps, and chocolates. The turndown service was a pleasant surprise. I returned to my room to find a plate of mini fruit tarts. Overall, the room is cleverly designed with luxurious amenities. If the owner/operators would do a little soundproofing, this just might a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not For The Timid or Faint of Heart”
Reviews.Author: omegaet
Reviews.Content: TWO MAJOR POINTS: (1)The Keating IS NOT for everyone! (2)The Keating IS PERECT for those who know what they want! We spent three unbelievable evenings at The Keating and loved every nuance of the experience. After reading some of the prior reviews, we did approach the hotel with some cautionâ€¦after all, â€œno shower doorsâ€� & â€œwater on the floorâ€� and not enjoying â€œquiet evenings.â€� Stay out of Gaslamp Quarter, if you are in search of â€œquietâ€�â€¦. try an assisted care living center for senior citizensâ€¦â€�lights out at 9:00 PM and no talking.â€� If you get a bit of water on the floorâ€¦call your personal conciergeâ€¦maybe it will be Christy or Anjiâ€¦ and they will have someone deliver your extra towels and take care of the wet floorâ€¦â€¦we know, we did! Donâ€™t waste your money on a Stanze Vistaâ€¦.split with the extra bucks and go for at least a â€œChicâ€� or â€œImperiale.â€� The in-room coffee maker is top of the lineâ€¦get extra canistersâ€¦you will covet the espresso! Pay attention during the in-room check-in process and ask questions if you donâ€™t understand how the remotes workâ€¦everything has a remote! Spend at least some time in the Minus-1 Loungeâ€¦great bar staff (check out the Vault)â€¦.the atmosphere and crowd starts picking up around mid-night. They also make it simple to figure out the difference between the Womenâ€™s Room and the Menâ€™s Room. Love that special Keating Naughty or Nice packageâ€¦.black silk pajamas, etc., etcâ€¦..wait â€˜till you see what the â€œturn downâ€� crew does to your room to make your evening memorable! Someone previously mentioned the â€œin room massageâ€�â€¦..thatâ€™s a must do! btwâ€¦when the street noise starts getting a little loud after 1:30 AMâ€¦.get dressed and go out and join the fun on 5th Aveâ€¦.be part of the problemâ€¦worry about the solution when you get home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Akitty
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. I hope they open more around the world. I will def. come back boutique is the new thing!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HLBSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible! The people working there are very RUDE! I would never go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has the worst service in the world”
Reviews.Author: LOL123456789
Reviews.Content: I was at the Minus 1 lounge on a Friday night, I ended up buying a bottle of Champagne for $180.00 when I received the bill it was 270.00 and some odd change... I had ordered some shots and food as well. The VIP waitress must have thought that I was drunk and stole money off of my credit card!!!!!! I looked at my account on-line and she only charged me 230.00 instead of the 270.00 plus I gave her a tip!! Of 30 dollars!!!!! So my bill was $300.00 In TOTAL! she decided to keep $70 as her tip for the night....... I called the General Manager the next day and SHE HAD THE NERVE TO LIE TO ME, I knew damn well what had happened, she said she would send me the receipt, but she didnâ€™t, she sent me a gift certificate for 50 dollars instead...with no receipt inside..... Which proves I was right in the first place!!!!? DONT GO TO THIS HOTEL THEY ARE LIARS AND THIEFS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloBunnyBabe
Reviews.Content: Our group of 12 VIP's from our company stayed at the Keating for a business meeting. Upon arrival, each person was greated curbside, by their names even, by the friendly Keating staff. Immediately their luggage was taken to their rooms while they checked them in, and from there it only got better. These VIP's are used to fine hotels and service, yet almost everyone from our group commented that the service was outstanding and attention to detail - impecable. It was like nothing they had experienced before, above and beyond in fact. The management and concierge service was beyond expectations as well. Prior to heading out for dinner and after a long day of meetings, our group wanted to have a drink. The manager went so far as to open the semi-private club (Minus 1, which is located downstairs in the Keating) on a day it's normally closed, for an hour just for us! Besides recommending decadent restaurants in the area for dinner, they went the extra mile and even walked us there so we wouldn't get lost and entertained us along the way. Whenever a minor problem would arise, they immediately would handle it and be solved to our satisfaction. I loved the Keating as did the majority of our group. It's very sleak, sexy and modern so it may not be everyone's taste but it worth a stay without question! As for those who complained of the noise in these reviews; during the week while we were there it was pretty quiet. If it does get loud, the Keating provides ear plugs and an eye mask in the rooms ammenities to help you sleep. But the GasLamp district is a hub of activity and energy, noise is to expected. The nightlife is outstanding in that neighborhood and beckons to be enjoyed. So perhaps if it does get loud on weekends there, I suggest you go out, have a few glasses of wine, soak up the vitality of the area, then go back to your room and put in the earplugs. You'll sleep just fine! :)

Reviews.Title: “was loved by the Keating and loved them back!”
Reviews.Author: SFNativeTraveller
Reviews.Content: It is rare that I am impressed by hotel service these days. I have lowered my expectations given the lack of service in general in the hotel industry. So I was completely taken aback at the truly outstanding service my girlfriend and I recently received at the Keating. The staff is so cheerful and helpful and the rooms are to die for! I know this is a little silly but we were both craving In & Out and our personnal conceirge actually went out and got our order! We felt like royalty. Thanks Keating!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bigb702
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Keating Hotel. I found the rooms to be quite comfortable, spacious , and luxurious. The staff was very professional and accomodating. I highly recommened the The -1 Lounge. The staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “In Love with The Keating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAXtraveler310
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend with a friend. We are frequent visitors to San Diego, and have been hearing a pretty good buzz about this new hotel in San Diego. Our stay was pretty amazing. I have stayed in boutique hotels similar to The Keating, but I have to say that I felt like a king here. Our room was incredible. I did not want to leave. I have to say, if you are in San Diego and have been to Europe, you will definitely enjoy this hotel. Definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: cwes760
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Keating in November. I was attracted to this location as it is Pinninfarina designed. I usually dont spend this much for a hotel stay but I decided to splurge and I must say I do not regret it one bit. From the moment I pulled up valet was right there to take my door and luggage. The service was very personal. The rooms were amazing and unique, all the employees were very helpful and called me by name. They offered so much service I felt as if I was being pampered. I usually dont shop that high when I look for hotels but I will definately stay here again as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Bad....”
Reviews.Author: URMalak
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel based on its location and after I was told it was a cool, happening place in San Diego's Gas Lamp District. After reading other reviews on this site and being told the same thing by others who have stayed here, to never stay in a room facing the Gas Lamp, I made a room change to an interior room at check-in. The room was sleek, ultra-modern, had great products,no privacy when taking a shower(not a prob for me, but others...)real nice flat panel TV, and quiet at night !! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, although I didnt understand the guy w/the dog in the lobby. The underground bar on Thurs nite was a blast, too ! I really liked this place and would return WITH an interior room !!

Reviews.Title: “Another horror night at the Keating”
Reviews.Author: LeftyKalem
Reviews.Content: I wrote a letter to the owner of this hotel, (something I have NEVER DONE) only to find this sight afterwards and when I read it, I saw that everyone who stayed at this hotel had the same reaction as us. My girlfriend has stayed at the W and found it to have very nice accomodations. Not one thing bad about the stay. She suggested we do the same, until I, unfortunately, made the suggestion that we stay at the Keating for 2 nights because the pictures and description looked appealing from hotels.com. NEVER AGAIN >>>>>>>> Our first night, we spent endless time trying to clean up the water from the shower (with no door) because it got all over our room and I was afraid my girlfriend would slip and hurt herself. The next morning we called for towels, and after 20 minutes, I had to go running up and down the stairs to try and find people to direct us where the towels were. SLEEP ????????? What hotel is in the main district with a bar next door and has single paned windows???? For $300.00 a night (plus 30.00 a night for parking?) At least at the Howard Johnson, you know what to expect and don't mind retrieving your own towels for $55.00 a pop. After we complained to the management upon leaving, all she had to say was, "WELL YOU DECIDED TO STAY HERE". WOW Now that we know better, we decide to not repeat that mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Keating Hotel in San Diego is extremely LOUD AND NOISEY.....”
Reviews.Author: 88Traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the Gas Lamp District. Very good location. One big problem....NOISE! The noise level is unreal. The bars go until 2 or 3 in the morning. The trash trucks and delivery trucks start at 5 and 6 AM. The hotel was built in the late 1800s and has been renovated nicely. EXCEPT THEY KEPT THE ORIGINAL WINDOWS. These windows are like the ones in your Great Grandparents house with the rope that goes to the weight inside the wall. Single pane glass and they don't close well. Sleeping in the hotel is like sleeping on the fire escape above the Gas Lamp district. We booked a long weekend and left after the first night. It also took the valet over 30 minutes to bring our car. (After he brought the wrong one the first time. Management is inexperienced. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “An Awful, Noisy Place---Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Double Scrutiny
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while cutesy in its decor, is awful. It is located in the middle of San Diego's hip nightlife section and the noise level is unbearable. There are bars everywhere, with the usual shrieking and loud merriment. As the evening progresses, the drunks get drunker and the noise level louder. Worst of all, the hotel lied to us about the noise level. When we called to book, we specifically inquired about the noise and advised that we wanted---and needed---a quiet room. The managment assured that a quiet room had been reserved and would be held for us. What a joke! Management knew the reserved room was not quiet and it should not have misrepresented that in the face of specific inquiries. In my view, sleeping on a park bench would be quieter. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: MDPCAL
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend trip and chose the Keating because of its location. It is convient to everything in the gaslamp district, but there lies the trouble with this property, the noise. The rooms were very nice, the bed comfortable and the cappuccino maker awesome. The shower was wonderful but no privacy so make sure you like your travel companions. I had an interior room, so did not experience the street noise. I was also on the opposite end as the club. However, my room was right behind the elevator which was the noisiest thing I've ever heard. Very annoying. The staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice at first, then terrible...”
Reviews.Author: the_best_dave_ever
Reviews.Content: On first blush, the Keating is a very nice boutique-y hotel right in the heart of the Gaslamp District (directly across the street from a really good Indian restaurant, btw). Having stayed in some exceptional hotels around the world, I was at first impressed by the modernish, european-ish look of the hotel. But look harder, and it begins to feel like an impression of a european boutique hotel. Not sure if this makes sense, but one is left with the feeling that the hotel is trying waaaaay to hard to be different. The staff could not be more accomodating... very helpful from reservation to check in. Wonderful all aroud. Sounds great, right? What's the problem? The problem is that the hotel is EASILY the LOUDEST hotel I have ever stayed at. The Junior suite we were in was directly above a club that seemed to go on all night long. The bed (a very comfy bed, mind you) was literally bumping along in time to the bass and drums below. (at one point, the band broke into "Shout!"... I thought I was going to pass out on the "Little bit louder now!" call and response). Also, the rooms all face the street as far as I can see, and the Gaslamp is SO LOUD at all hours. Good luck sleeping. And since the building is a historical building, they can't put sound proof windows in (I was told). I cant stress to you HOW LOUD THE NIGHT WAS.... I sound like my parents complaining that 'those whippersnappers were up all night...' but that is what it was like. Neither my wife nor I slept more than two hours, give or take. The rooms provide noise machines for your convenience, but that's like turning on the shower to cover up for the cheers from the Superbowl. Terrible, terrible, terrible... And to add insult to injury, upon complaining to the management, the response I got was: "Well, this is the Gaslamp. It does get loud." No apologies, no nothing. For the price we paid, this was waaaay more than insulting. Ive stayed at MANY other hotels in the Gaslamp and NEVER had this problem. So... if you're going to San Diego and have to stay in the Gaslamp, do yourself a favor. Go to the U.S. Grant or any of the other fine, yet not all tricked out hotels in the area. Trust me... the fancy shower box and plasma tv is not worth your mind-numbing lack of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “TOO Minimal”
Reviews.Author: writer2006
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Keating is like dragging your bed to a fancy club. Sure, it looks amazing and can be fun, but the looks only go so far when it's too loud and the atmosphere sucks. The Keating is minimalist to the extreme. I'm the type of person that loves everything modern; stainless anything and everything is my style, but when paying $300+ a night I at least expect a separate bathroom, a shower with doors, perhaps a bath tub, carpeting (not painted cement floors!), and at the very least more than single-pane windows (ESPECIALLY when you are in the middle of the nightclub district). This is the first and only hotel that I will say I spent more hours lying awake than I did sleeping. I went to bed at 11pm, but due to the constant and extremely loud (so loud you can hardly hear your own thoughts) noise outside from cars, drunk people and the band that was playing directly four floors below our room. Finally I believe I fell asleep sometime around midnight. I was then woke up at 2 am to the sounds of people screaming in horror "STOP... DON'T DO IT!" I ran to the window to see two girls punching each other and chasing each other around with a crowd of at least 50 people watching and cheering. Keep in mind this isn't happening way down the street, it is DIRECTLY outside our window. After almost 10 minutes the police finally arrive, at this point the girls have chased each other into the streets and almost caused multiple accidents. Then an ambulance arrives and takes one girl away. I'm not sure whether the girl was that badly hurt from the fight, got hit by a car, or what. And, this wasn't just a rare occurence. The hotel staff informed us that just the night before there was another fight directly outside the hotel with two girls beating each other with high heels. After all this excitement I finally got back to sleep at about 3:30am. I woke up at 8am to the sounds of cars outside and soon after that housekeeping was sure to come by. At check-out the hotel then tried to charge me for use of some lounge, which I had never even heard of let alone spent money at. After some griping they removed the $100 charge. And, I should also mention NOT to use a credit card if you dare choose to stay at the hotel. Apparently they have some issues with their credit card machine because I used my credit card to check-in and everything seemed to be fine at first until they called the room at 11pm (and got me out of bed) to come downstairs to give them another form of payment because it would not work. I know for a fact that it was not an issue with my card because I called my credit card company and they had no problems, and furthermore I used that same credit card three times the next day without any problems. I DO NOT recommend The Keating. There are so many other nice hotels to stay at. I had stayed at the Holiday Inn on the Bay the night before and it was a MUCH better hotel even if it wasn't as "hip and modern" as this one; at least the Holiday Inn knows not to have single-pane windows.

HotelInfo.Name: The Keating Hotel by Pininfarina
HotelInfo.Address: 432 F Street, San Diego, CA 92101
